p: The common cold is a prevalent, complex and heterogeneous illness. 8 More than 10 species of respiratory viruses exist, and they contain hundreds of subspecies with different immunopathologies. 9 10 Signs and symptoms of different viral infections overlap, and it is not possible to identify the aetiological agent on clinical grounds alone. 11 12 Antiviral treatment is only available for influenza, but virus-specific preventive measures may reduce the transmission of illnesses. 13 14
